alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 28 at 8:48PM CDT until July 28 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CARROLL...SOUTHERN JACKSON AND NORTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 848 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Andrew, or 8 miles northeast of Maquoketa, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Broadcast media confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornado will be near... Springbrook around 855 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Spragueville, Preston, Green Island, Van Buren, Miles, Reeceville, Bryant, Savanna, Andover, Camp Miss-Elk-Ton, Teeds Grove, Mississippi Palisades State Park, Sabula and South Sabula Lake Park. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
